overview: The purpose and intent of this measure is to make appropriations and approve payments for claims against the State, state officers, and state employees. [12] Your Committee finds that appropriating moneys and authorizing the efficient settlement of claims will promote financial responsibility and allow state agencies to focus on their core missions. [12]
agency_impact: The Hawaii Department of Transportation supports H.B. 990, H.D. 2, S.D. 1 that authorizes judgements and settlements for claims against the State. [11] The Hawaii State Department of Education supports this measure, which enables timely resolution of legal obligations and allows the Department to focus on its core mission of educating Hawaii's students. [11] The Department of Hawaiian Home Lands supports this bill which will allow DHHL to focus on its mission to develop and deliver land to native Hawaiians and effectively manage the Hawaiian Home Lands trust. [11]
economic_impact: This measure enables timely resolution of legal obligations, preventing unnecessary litigation and financial burdens. [11] Appropriating these funds ensures fiscal responsibility and protects essential educational resources. [11] The Committee on Ways and Means finds that appropriating moneys and authorizing the efficient settlement of claims will promote financial responsibility. [12]
updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: The previous fiscal note detailed amendments that increased the total appropriation request to $7,854,458.74 (HB990_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_04-01-25_.PDF.txt) for thirty-one claims. [11] This update reflects the bill's progression through the Senate Committee on Ways and Means, which received written comments in support of this measure from the Department of Transportation, Department of Education, Attorney General, and Department of Hawaiian Home Lands. [12] Your Committee is in accord with the intent and purpose of H.B. No. 990, H.D. 2, S.D. 1, and recommends that it pass Third Reading. [12]
